alert.note: Alert for Essex; Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 04 at 5:02PM EDT until May 06 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River At Pine Brook affecting Essex, Passaic, and Morris Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Passaic River At Pine Brook. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Street flooding begins in Fairfield including Camp Lane Road. Two Bridges Road is closed going into Lincoln Park and Wayne. At 19.5 feet, Horseneck Road in Fairfield is subject to flooding and closures. At 20.0 feet, Eagle Rock Avenue in Roseland is subject to flooding. Camp Lane Road, River Edge Drive and Broadway Lane in Fairfield are flooded. Stewart Place is closed. At 20.5 feet, Bloomfield Avenue in West Caldwell floods. Matt Drive, Brook Street and Oak Road in Fairfield are flooded and subject to closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 19.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:15 PM EDT Thursday was 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Saturday afternoon and continue falling to 18.7 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.6 feet on 12/08/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (8 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Stg Time Date Passaic River Pine Brook 19.0 19.7 Thu 4 pm 19.3 18.9 Crested &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Friday morning by 600 AM EDT.
